trans-unit.source: In this step, we test the solution by dropping a flat-file message to a folder on the FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: In this step, we test the solution by dropping a flat-file message to a folder on the FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: The <token>one-way</token> should consume this message, process it, and then insert the values into the <embeddedLabel>OrderDetails</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> database <token>ssNoVersion</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>one-way</token> should consume this message, process it, and then insert the values into the <embeddedLabel>OrderDetails</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> database <token>ssNoVersion</token>.

trans-unit.source: To send a message to the bridge
trans-unit.target: To send a message to the bridge

trans-unit.source: Locate the <embeddedLabel>Orders.txt</embeddedLabel> message from the location you downloaded the <embeddedLabel>FTP_EAI_Tutorial</embeddedLabel> sample and copy it to a folder on the FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Locate the <embeddedLabel>Orders.txt</embeddedLabel> message from the location you downloaded the <embeddedLabel>FTP_EAI_Tutorial</embeddedLabel> sample and copy it to a folder on the FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> you configured as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token> must be configured to pick messages from this folder.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> you configured as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token> must be configured to pick messages from this folder.

trans-unit.source: The Orders.txt message has the following content:
trans-unit.target: The Orders.txt message has the following content:

trans-unit.source: Wait for the message to disappear.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the message to disappear.

trans-unit.source: Now go to the <embeddedLabel>OrderDetails</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> database and verify the new values are inserted:
trans-unit.target: Now go to the <embeddedLabel>OrderDetails</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> database and verify the new values are inserted:

trans-unit.source: Note that the values correspond to the data in the flat-file message that you dropped to the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Note that the values correspond to the data in the flat-file message that you dropped to the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Because you configured the <token>bridge</token> to track message properties, you can also view the tracked data.
trans-unit.target: Because you configured the <token>bridge</token> to track message properties, you can also view the tracked data.

trans-unit.source: Go to the <token>tpm_portal</token> registered for your <token>af_integration</token> subscription, select the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> tab, select the <embeddedLabel>Route: Route</embeddedLabel> activity information, and then from the command bar, select <embeddedLabel>Details</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <token>tpm_portal</token> registered for your <token>af_integration</token> subscription, select the <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> tab, select the <embeddedLabel>Route: Route</embeddedLabel> activity information, and then from the command bar, select <embeddedLabel>Details</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up window, notice that the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> properties are tracked and their values are also displayed:
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up window, notice that the <embeddedLabel>OrderId</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>TotalAmount</embeddedLabel> properties are tracked and their values are also displayed:

trans-unit.source: Note that the tracked values correspond to the values that are inserted into the <token>ssNoVersion</token> database.
trans-unit.target: Note that the tracked values correspond to the values that are inserted into the <token>ssNoVersion</token> database.
